subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text: {{ja-kanji|grade=2|rs=弓00}}

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ゆ}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=ゆ|-}}. In modern {{cog|ja|-}}, only found as a prefix in compounds.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|ゆ}}

subSections.title: Prefix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|prefix|ゆ}}

# a [[bow]], a bow [[shape]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|弓 (楽器)}} {{wikipedia|Bow (music)}} [[File:Bows-ViolaBassGdulkaKemence.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|弓}} (''yumi''): Four different types of '''bow'''.]] {{wikipedia|lang=ja|弓 (武器)}} {{wikipedia|Bow and arrow}} [[File:Yumi-p1000624.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|弓}} (''yu'', ''yumi'', ''tarashi'', ''kyū''): Japanese '''bows''', arrows, and arrow-stand.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ゆみ}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=ゆみ|-}}. Appears in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'' (c. 759 {{CE}}). A surface analysis suggests a combination of {{cog|ojp|-}} ''yu'' (see above) + suffixing element ''mi'', itself of uncertain derivation.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|ゆみ|acc=2|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ゆみ}}

# a [[bow]]:
## {{lb|ja|weaponry|sort=ゆみ}} a bow for shooting [[arrow]]s
## {{lb|ja|musical instrument|sort=ゆみ}} a bow for playing a [[stringed instrument]] such as a [[violin]] or [[cello]]
# [[archery]]
# {{lb|ja|Shinto|sort=ゆみ}} a type of [[kagura]] (sacred Shinto song and dance) intended to drive away [[evil]]
# short for {{ja-r|破%魔 弓|は%ま ゆみ}}: a ceremonial archery bow with the power to dispel evil
# a bow [[shape]], a [[curve]]
# a bow-shaped [[tool]] used to [[beat]] [[ginned]] [[cotton]] into a softer and finer [[textile]]

subSections.title: Coordinate terms
subSections.text: * {{sense|archery}} {{ja-l|矢|や|ya}}: an [[arrow]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
See also
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|ロングボウ||longbow}}

subSections.title: Further reading
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|たらし}}

Alteration from ''torashi'', {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem or continuative form}} of verb ''torasu'', from ''tora'' as the {{m|ja|未然形|tr=mizenkei||incomplete form}} of verb {{m|ja|取る|tr=toru||to take}} + {{m|ja|す|tr=su|pos=honorific suffix in {{etyl|ojp|-}}}}. Original meaning was “something kept [[to hand]]”.<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR"/>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|たらし}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|たらし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=たらし|rare|honorific}} an [[archery]] [[bow]], particularly one belonging to a [[noble]]

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|御%執|み%たらし|rom=-}}, {{ja-r|御%弓|み%たらし}}

subSections.title: Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=kanon|きゅう}}

From {{bor|ja|ltc|sort=きゅう|-}} {{ltc-l|弓}}.<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR"/> Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{m|zh|弓|tr=gōng}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=kan|きゅう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|きゅう}}

# {{lb|ja|rare|sort=きゅう}} a [[bow]]
# {{lb|ja|obsolete|sort=きゅう}} in [[ancient]] [[Chinese]] [[archery]], a [[unit]] of [[length]] for measuring the [[distance]] between the [[archer]] and the [[target]]; one ''kyū'' was equal to six {{m|ja|尺|tr=shaku}}, roughly six [[feet]] or 182 [[centimeter]]s
# {{lb|ja|obsolete|sort=きゅう}} in [[ancient]] [[China]], a [[unit]] of [[length]] for [[survey]]ing [[land]]; one ''kyū'' was equal to eight {{m|ja|尺|tr=shaku}}, roughly eight [[feet]] or 242 [[centimeter]]s

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: In modern {{etyl|ja|-}}, the reading ''kyū'' is most often found in compounds.

subSections.title: Derived terms
References
subSections.text: <references/>
